zc.thread
Class Mutex

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--zc.thread.Mutex
All Implemented Interfaces:
Lock
public class Mutex
extends java.lang.Object
implements Lock

A reentrant mutual exclusion lock. The owning thread can recursively acquire the same mutex multiple times, but there must be a matching release for every acquire before some other thread can acquire the mutex at its turn. Mutex can be useful in constructions that cannot be expressed using java synchronized blocks because the acquire/release pairs do not occur in the same method or code block.

See Also:
Semaphore, FIFOSemaphore

Field Detail

fOwner

protected volatile java.lang.Thread fOwner
The thread that currently own this mutex, or null if this mutex is up (not owned by anyone).

fCount

protected volatile int fCount
Count how many times the owner thread recursively acquired this Mutex. This mutex will not be released until this counter reach zero.
Constructor Detail

Mutex

public Mutex()
Method Detail

acquire

public void acquire()
             throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Acquire this mutex.

If this mutex is already owned by another thread then the calling thread will block until this mutex is released or the, then blocked, thread is interrupted.

It is legal for a thread to re-acquire the same mutex. The mutex will not be released until as many release as acquire have occurred.

Specified by:
acquire in interface Lock
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - {@inheritDoc}

attempt

public boolean attempt(long msecs)
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
Try to acquire this mutex without blocking.
Specified by:
attempt in interface Lock
Parameters:
msecs - the number of milliseconds to wait for this mutex before giving up.
Returns:
true if this mutex has been acquired within the given time.
Throws:
java.lang.InterruptedException - {@inheritDoc}

release

public void release()
             throws java.lang.IllegalMonitorStateException
Release this mutex.

If this mutex has been acquired multiple time by the owner thread then it will not be released until as many release as acquire have occurred.

Specified by:
release in interface Lock
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalMonitorStateException - if the current thread is not the owner of this mutex. It is an error for a thread to call release on a mutex not owned by the thread.

getCount

public int getCount()
Return the number of times the owner thread recursively acquired this Mutex or zero if there is no current owner.
Returns:
an int.

getOwner

public java.lang.Thread getOwner()
Return the thread that owns this mutex, or null if there is no current owner.
Returns:
a Thread object.
